instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message:
Strange. No sign of liquid or drop damage

Customer says it occassionally doesn't boot 
Soemtimes don't wake up from sleep
occasionally wakes up to prohibiting sign.

I suspected ssd so i try to boot from external USB. It didn't work.

I tried another good working ssd it booted to osx 
I tried external USB again and it booted to osx 
I then tried original ssd and it booted to osx this time.

Where is good point to start?
Test all voltages?

I noticed also when I boot to recovery and check terminal date was incorrect also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message:
So it doesn't boot always from USB?
Do yo always get chime?

PRAM done?

Can you always acces boot menu?
Even if you only get network option...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message:
It doesn't always boot from USB and sad
always chime

Pram done

Can always access boot menu

Sometimes takes veryyy long to boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message: AHA! <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> got fluff around it very hard to see.. could this be the cause for all these issues?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message:
Could be, as it is a PCH power supply.
Change it and check its output (1.05V at pins 5/7).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermittent boot sleep issue
threads.message: nice. all done working great now. :) thanks informaticos!!
